information: Electronic waste contains toxic materials like lead
source: and cadmium. Proper disposal prevents soil and water contamination. E-waste recycling recovers valuable materials like gold and silver.
column8: Take electronics to certified e-waste centers. Check for manufacturer take-back programs.

information: Only 9% of plastic ever produced has been recycled. Single-use plastics contribute significantly to ocean pollution. Recycling reduces energy consumption by 75% compared to new production.
action_items: Reduce single-use plastics. Use reusable alternatives. Clean plastics before recycling.

information: Organic waste in landfills produces methane
sdg_target: a potent greenhouse gas. Composting reduces methane emissions and creates nutrient-rich soil. Reduces waste by 30%.
column7: Start home composting. Use municipal composting services. Avoid meat and dairy in compost.

information: Reducing energy consumption decreases carbon emissions. Energy-efficient appliances can reduce household energy use by 30%. Renewable energy sources are crucial for sustainability.
action_items: Use LED bulbs. Unplug devices when not in use. Choose renewable energy providers.

information: Only 2.5% of Earth's water is fresh. Water conservation reduces energy needed for treatment and distribution. Fixing leaks can save thousands of gallons annually.
action_items: Fix leaks immediately. Use water-efficient fixtures. Collect rainwater for gardening.

information: The average person produces 4 tons of CO2 annually. Transportation accounts for 29% of greenhouse gas emissions. Reducing consumption lowers carbon footprint.
action_items: Use public transport. Reduce air travel. Choose local products.

information: Buying less and choosing quality over quantity reduces waste. The circular economy model promotes reuse and recycling. Sustainable choices protect resources for future generations.
action_items: Buy only what you need. Choose durable products. Support sustainable brands.

information: Hazardous waste improperly disposed can contaminate soil and groundwater for decades. Pharmaceuticals in water systems affect aquatic life. Proper disposal protects ecosystems.
action_items: Never pour chemicals down drains. Use designated collection centers. Return expired medicines to pharmacies.

information: The fashion industry produces 10% of global carbon emissions. Textiles take 200+ years to decompose. Donating and recycling extends product life.
action_items: Donate wearable clothes. Buy second-hand. Choose sustainable fabrics.

information: One-third of all food produced is wasted. Food waste in landfills produces methane. Reducing food waste saves resources and reduces hunger.
action_items: Plan meals to reduce waste. Store food properly. Compost food scraps.
